intro: Sphaerostephanos lobatus, commonly known as the lobed starflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Onagraceae, which includes other starflowers and willows. The plant is characterized by its small, star-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of yellow and white. Its leaves are alternate and often lobed, giving it the species name "lobatus." Sphaerostephanos lobatus is adapted to high-altitude environments and thrives in cool, moist conditions.
